questions.text: Match the following triplets
Find out the Selective inhibitor of nuclear export (SINE) useful in treating this condition
Which of the following drugs acts by inhibiting Na+-H+ exchanger (NHE), useful in C- IBS?
Which medication is used to prevent acute chest syndrome and reduce the need for blood transfusions in patients with sickle cell anemia by acting as a nitric oxide donor?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Hydroxyurea Function: Increases fetal hemoglobin (HbF) levels, which reduces red blood cell sickling and decreases the frequency of pain crises and acute chest syndrome. Penicillin Function: Used as prophylaxis to prevent infections, especially in young children with sickle cell anemia, to protect against encapsulated bacteria such as Streptococcus pneumoniae. Deferasirox Function: An iron chelator used to manage iron overload due to frequent blood transfusions, preventing iron-related organ damage. Folic Acid Function: Supports red blood cell production and helps in the synthesis of DNA, reducing the risk of anemia-related complications. Pain Management (e.g., Acetaminophen, NSAIDs) Function: Used to manage pain during sickle cell crises. Opioids may also be used for severe pain. Blood Transfusions Function: Used to treat severe anemia, reduce the risk of stroke, and manage complications such as acute chest syndrome. Erythropoietin (in specific cases) Function: Can be used to stimulate red blood cell production in cases of severe anemia. Voxelotor Function: A newer drug that increases hemoglobin's affinity for oxygen, thereby reducing sickling and hemolysis. Crizanlizumab Function: A monoclonal antibody that targets P-selectin to reduce the frequency of vaso-occlusive crises.

Which of the following biochemical parameter is not raised in pre-eclampsia?

There is physiological vasodilation in pregnancy. The reason for the same is cytotrophoblastic invasion into the maternal vessels. Which of the following is considered as the 2nd wave of invasion which happens at 16 weeks?

options.label: A
options.text: Invasion of spiral arteries by intravascular cytotrophoblast

options.label: B
options.text: Invasion of spiral arteries by villous cytotrophoblast

options.label: C
options.text: Invasion of radial arteries by intravascular cytotrophoblast

options.label: D
options.text: Invasion of radial arteries by interstitial cytotrophoblast

questions.correct_answer: C. Invasion of radial arteries by intravascular cytotrophoblast

questions.text: Which of the following is not possible in partial molar pregnancy?
A 32 years old G4A3 has history of 3 abortions of less than 12 weeks in past. She is 8 weeks pregnant now. Which of the following is not the possible cause?
Identify the given procedure used during breech delivery:
Identify the given position:
A G4P3L3 with 35 weeks of gestation with cephalic presentation has undergone caesarean section. After caesarean, the patient will belong to which group of ROBSON classification?

A 39 years old nulliparous patient has 39 weeks of gestation with cephalic presentation. She has painful fluid filled vesicles on the labia minora and majora. She is in labour. What should be the treatment plan in this case?

options.label: B
options.text: Give Acyclovir and do vaginal delivery

questions.correct_answer: A. Give Acyclovir and do LSCS

questions.text: A girl presented with amenorrhea. Which of the following will be classified as primary amenorrhea?

options.label: A
options.text: 14 years old with tanner stage 1 breast

options.label: B
options.text: 13 years old with tanner stage 5 breast

options.label: C
options.text: 12 years old with tanner stage 4 breast

options.label: D
options.text: 11 years old with tanner stage 1 breast

questions.correct_answer: A. 14 years old with tanner stage 1 breast

questions.text: A 27 years old primigravida has 18 weeks of gestation. She is having fishy foul-smelling vaginal discharge and the pH of the discharge is 4.8. Which of the following is the drug of choice in this case?
The treatment of choice for carcinoma of cervix which has spread till the parametrium is?

A 32 years old multiparous patient has come to the opd with complains of continuous wetness of genitalia with strong smell of urine. She is able to pass urine normally. She has history of difficult vaginal delivery 6 months ago. What is the most likely cause?
Which one of the following structures is made from caudal end of Wolffian tubules in females?

There is a 24 years old nulliparous patient who has purulent vaginal discharge and lower abdominal pain. Her UPT is negative and on examination, there is uterine tenderness. Which colour kit is suitable for her?
A 23 years old primigravida with 10 weeks of gestation has uterine prolapse of stage 2. What is the best line of management in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Do MTP and then sling surgery

questions.text: A 52 years old patient has FIGO-1 fibroid of 4 cm which is causing post-menopausal bleeding. What is the best line of management in this case?
A 21 years old nulliparous patient has unruptured ectopic for which she is undergoing multiple dose regimen of MTx therapy. The following table shows the details of her treatment.

options.label: A
options.text: Give injection methotrexate, continue monitoring and complete 4 doses of methotrexate

options.label: B
options.text: Give injection methotrexate since b-HCG has not fallen by 15% from the first value

options.label: C
options.text: No need of further injections and no need of further monitoring

options.label: D
options.text: No need of further injections but do weekly b-HCG monitoring.

questions.correct_answer: D. No need of further injections but do weekly b-HCG monitoring.

questions.text: Which one of the following cases is not having uterus?
A 72 years old post-menopausal female has cervical cancer of stage 1A1 with lympho-vascular space invasion. What is the best treatment for her?
Which of the following does not require chemotherapy?
What electrolyte abnormality is more common in dehydrated patients with cystic fibrosis than in otherwise healthy dehydrated patients?

A 9-day-old girl is brought to an urgent care facility for evaluation because she has not been feeding well for several days. She has solely been breastfed. There is no other bothersome history: No fever, no rash, no exposure to ill persons, no concerning information. The urgent care physician is worried when she sees the neonate and sends her to the emergency department (ED) for treatment. In the ED she appears tired but not truly lethargic in the medical sense; an IV line is placed, blood is obtained for laboratory studies, and she is given a 20 mL/kg normal saline bolus. After obtaining the history, the ED physician decides that the neonate would be best served by admission, and you, as the pediatrician on call, agree to take over her care. She improves following fluid administration in the ED, but when you arrive shortly thereafter, you are told that her serum sodium is 165 mEq/L. She appears well and her vital signs are within normal limits; the only other exam finding of note is mild jaundice. Her mother tells you that her birthweight was 3.5 kg, and you notice that her weight in triage was 3.0 kg. The child's mother also asks if it is normal for the child to sweat while feeding, as she has done occasionally since birth. What findings would be expected if the child had hypernatremia due to diabetes Insipidus (DI)?

options.label: A
options.text: High serum osmolality, low urine osmolality.

options.label: B
options.text: Low serum osmolality, low urine osmolality.

options.label: C
options.text: High serum osmolality, high urine osmolality.

options.label: D
options.text: Low serum osmolality, high urine osmolality.

options.label: E
options.text: Her serum sodium will always be abnormal.

questions.correct_answer: A. High serum osmolality, low urine osmolality.

questions.text: A 2-month-old male infant presents with jaundice. Initial exam is remarkable for jaundice, scleral icterus, and hepatomegaly without a palpable spleen. Initial laboratory results were remarkable for AST 1 50 units/L, ALT 300 units/L, GGT 82 units/L, and normal PT, INR, albumin, and glucose. His total bilirubin was 6 mg/ dL, with a direct bilirubin of 3.2 mg/dL. The workup was negative for infectious etiologies, and an ultrasound showed mild hepatomegaly with a homogenous liver without signs of portal hypertension or sonographic evidence of biliary obstruction. Subsequently, a HIDA scan showed good excretion of bile into the intestine. What are the next steps in the care of this patient?
In the setting of extrahepatic biliary atresia, what is the optimal age for a Kasai (hepatoportoenterostomy) procedure?

options.label: A
options.text: At 6 months of age after the infant has grown and developed (to guard against surgical complications) .

options.label: B
options.text: At 4 months of age, because the infant can begin to transition to solid foods after recovering from surgery.

options.label: C
options.text: At 3 months of age, because the bile ducts are better visualized.

options.label: D
options.text: Before 2 months of age to have the greatest success in obtaining bile flow.

questions.correct_answer: D. Before 2 months of age to have the greatest success in obtaining bile flow.

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy was playing at his uncle's house at night when he found a hypodermic needle and accidentally punctured his thumb with it. His father brought him immediately to be evaluated by you in the emergency department. The father thinks there was blood on the needle and is concerned that the child's uncle may be an IV drug user. Dad does not know any of the uncle's medical history and he is not available to speak with at this time. The child is otherwise healthy. Dad thinks he has gotten the recommended immunizations but is not sure if he completed his hepatitis B series. His records are not available. Exam shows a small puncture wound in the thumb with some dried blood on the skin. You are concerned about preventing transmission of hepatitis B and decide that you should:

options.label: A
options.text: Immediately give a dose of hepatitis B vaccine.

options.label: B
options.text: Immediately give a dose of hepatitis B immune globulin.

options.label: C
options.text: Obtain a hepatitis B surface antibody measurement.

options.label: D
options.text: Obtain a hepatitis B surface antigen measurement.

questions.correct_answer: C. Obtain a hepatitis B surface antibody measurement.

questions.text: According to new NRP 8th edition, which of following is not a new addition in it?

options.label: A
options.text: ‘How many babies?’ added to the pre-birth questionnaire

options.label: B
options.text: Initial steps: Warm, dry, stimulate, position airway, suction if needed.

options.label: C
options.text: When an alternative airway becomes necessary, a cardiac monitor is recommended for the most accurate assessment of the baby’s heart rate

options.label: D
options.text: Flush IV/IO epinephrine with 3 mL normal saline (applies to all weights and gestational ages)

questions.correct_answer: A. ‘How many babies?’ added to the pre-birth questionnaire

questions.text: If heart rate is not improving despite PPV in a newborn baby, which of the following step is NOT needed?

options.label: C
options.text: Increase the pressure in 10-20 cm H2O increments

questions.correct_answer: C. Increase the pressure in 10-20 cm H2O increments

questions.text: A 2 wk old male infant is eating poorly, has repeated emesis, and has not regained his birth weight. On physical examination he appears dehydrated and is noted to have increased pigmentation of skin creases and genitalia. In addition to measuring serum electrolytes, assay of which of the following hormones would be most informative?

A 14-day old male infant is brought to the Emergency Department because of difficulty feeding, vomiting, and lethargy. Physical examination reveals temperature=37°C, heart rate=190 beats per minute, blood pressure=55/30 (mean=34) mm Hg, and respiratory rate=60 breaths per minute. The infant’s anterior fontanel is sunken and his skin turgor is poor with a capillary refill time of 5 seconds. Which of the following laboratory findings are MOST consistent with the diagnosis of congenital adrenal hyperplasia resulting from 21-hydroxylase deficiency?

options.label: A
options.text: Sodium=124 mEq/L, potassium=6.2 mEq/L, chloride=86 mEq/L

questions.correct_answer: A. Sodium=124 mEq/L, potassium=6.2 mEq/L, chloride=86 mEq/L

questions.text: A fetus at 20 weeks’ gestation is diagnosed with congenital heart block. Which of the following statements about neonatal lupus erythematosus (NLE) is FALSE?

options.label: A
options.text: Anti-SSA/Ro and anti-SSB/La antibodies are nearly universally found in the serum of women whose fetuses are diagnosed in utero with congenital heart block

options.label: B
options.text: Complete congenital heart block is irreversible and surviving children typically require pacing

options.label: C
options.text: Congenital heart block resulting from NLE is typically diagnosed between 16 and 24 weeks’ gestation

options.label: D
options.text: The majority of mothers of neonates diagnosed with congenital heart block have symptoms of systemic lupus erythematosus

options.label: E
options.text: The mortality rate of congenital heart block in NLE is approximately 20%

questions.correct_answer: D. The majority of mothers of neonates diagnosed with congenital heart block have symptoms of systemic lupus erythematosus

questions.text: Identify the correct anatomies from the CT scan given below:

options.label: A
options.text: A. Kidney, B. Liver, C. Pancrea

options.label: B
options.text: A. Liver, B. Pancreas, C. Spleen

options.label: C
options.text: A. Spleen, B. Kidney, C. Liver

options.label: D
options.text: A. Pancreas, B. Liver, C. Spleen

questions.correct_answer: B. A. Liver, B. Pancreas, C. Spleen

questions.text: A patient was brought to the emergency department after a road traffic accident. His CT scan is shown below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following radioisotopes is used in a PET-CT scan?
Identify the structure in the given image
Identify the view given in the X-ray?
